definition: burden
to implicate/to involve
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Studies have confirmed that past immigration has become a cost factor for the economy.
sentences.chinese: 研究確認過去的移民已經成爲經濟的負累。

sentences.english: BingYin son is afraid to stay and become a negative tired, leave a book.
sentences.chinese: 丙寅爲怕留下來成爲兒子負累，便留書出走。

sentences.english: This type of code execution is punishing to a database.
sentences.chinese: 這類代碼執行對於數據庫來說是個負累。

sentences.english: Newcomers to an organization sometimes get stuck with work over and above their job description.
sentences.chinese: 新進人員有時候會被很多職責範圍以外的工作所負累。

sentences.english: They think a kid is a burden and they enjoy less.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲生活已是負累，爲什麼還要添孩子。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
insignificant
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to bind/to yoke/to impede
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
separated in life and death/to part for ever
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
idealism
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
resentment/grudge
